page.title: 04Industry
page.content: There are many companies both large and small using premises on the Industrial Estate. Industry began arriving in the area in 1946 expansion of the estate started in the 1960s but today firms are moving out. One of the largest Firestone tyres has closed Courtaulds Fibres are closing and many other small factory units have had to close. There are still a small number of large factories left Kellog's cereals B.I.C.C. and Tetra Pak are examples. Smaller companies seem to be service or light engineering companies and also modern technology firms. One small garage deals exclusvley with Morris 1000 cars and parts. The W.D.A. has an office on the estate and they are now building small advanced factory units.
